strategicAnalysis.executiveSummary: This Space Wolves list is a formidable 'HeroHammer' composition that sacrifices board width for an overwhelming concentration of durability and melee lethality. Built around a massive Terminator 'Death Star' led by Logan Grimnar and Arjac, and supported by fast-moving Thunderwolf Cavalry, the army functions as a crushing avalanche that seeks to table the opponent rather than winning on technical scoring. Success relies on precise timing of the 'Master of Wolves' Sagas to deliver a knockout blow on Turn 2 or 3 while the Vindicator and Inceptors strip enemy armor.

armyArchetype.description: With only 50 models at 2000 points and a heavy investment in Terminators and Cavalry, every unit is a high-value asset designed to absorb punishment and trade up in combat.

strategicStrengths.title: Layered Durability
strategicStrengths.description: Between Storm Shields (4++ Invulnerable saves) on Terminators/TWC and the 'The Foe Foreseen' stratagem to worsen enemy AP, this army is incredibly resistant to high-AP fire.

strategicStrengths.title: Flexible Lethality via Sagas
strategicStrengths.description: The ability to switch the entire army between 'Encircling Jaws' (mobility) and 'Ferocious Strike' (damage) allows you to adapt to the game state instantly.

strategicStrengths.title: Deep Strike Pressure
strategicStrengths.description: Nearly half the army's points (Terminators + Inceptors) can start off the board, forcing opponents to screen their backline and reducing the fire the TWC take on Turn 1.

strategicWeaknesses.title: Severe Board Control Deficit
strategicWeaknesses.description: With only 12 units and 50 models, you cannot screen your own deployment zone effectively against 3-inch deep strikes or hyper-mobile armies.
strategicWeaknesses.counterplayRisk: Opponents will drop scoring units behind your lines or move-block your Terminators.
strategicWeaknesses.mitigationStrategy: Use the 'Chariots of the Storm' enhancement to redeploy units into Strategic Reserves to counter enemy deployment, and use the Lieutenant with Combi-weapon to screen your backfield objectives.

strategicWeaknesses.title: Reliance on Charge Rolls
strategicWeaknesses.description: The Terminators are slow (M5/6). Failing a 9-inch charge out of Deep Strike leaves almost 500 points useless for a turn.
strategicWeaknesses.counterplayRisk: Kiting and screening with cheap chaff.
strategicWeaknesses.mitigationStrategy: Save the 'Encircling Jaws' Saga for the turn your reserves arrive to get Charge re-rolls, or use 'Grimnar's Mark' for a free Rapid Ingress on the Terminator Captain's unit to move closer before charging.

matchupConsiderations.reasoning: You lack high-volume ranged anti-tank. The Vindicator is your only dedicated long-range gun. You must get into melee to win.
keyTips: Use 'Ferocious Strike' for Lethal Hits to bypass high Toughness.
Deep Strike Arjac and Terminators to charge vehicles directly.
Protect the Vindicator at all costs.

matchupConsiderations.reasoning: Your units are tougher and hit harder in melee than almost any other faction. You also have 'Fight on Death' mechanics via Arjac.
keyTips: Let them charge you, then use 'Howlmaw' to force Battle-shock.
Use 'Unrelenting Hunters' to Fall Back and Charge again for bonuses.
Pop 'The Foe Foreseen' in the Fight phase.

matchupConsiderations.reasoning: You can kill models easily, but they can out-OC you on objectives. You simply don't have enough bodies to hold 4+ objectives.
keyTips: Use the Inceptors and Vindicator Blast weapons to clear chaff.
Focus on killing their scoring units, not their damage dealers.
Consolidate onto objectives to flip them with OC.

strongSecondaries.name: Assassination
strongSecondaries.reasoning: This list is designed to hunt characters with 'Epic Challenge' opportunities and deep striking terminators.

strongSecondaries.name: Storm Hostile Objective
strongSecondaries.reasoning: You want to charge onto objectives anyway. Thunderwolf Cavalry are excellent at flipping points.

avoidSecondaries.name: Cleanse
avoidSecondaries.reasoning: You cannot afford to have your expensive elite units doing actions instead of fighting.

avoidSecondaries.name: Investigate Signals
avoidSecondaries.reasoning: Requires being in corners/center without shooting/charging. A waste of your 300+ point units.

collectionRecommendations.reason: Cheap screening units and action monkeys are desperately needed to hold home objectives.
Provides an assault ramp for the Terminators or Headtakers to charge after moving, fixing the mobility issue.

keyThreats: Logan Grimnar + Arjac + 10 Terminators (The Death Star)
counterStrategies: Screen out deep strikes to force the Terminators to walk.
Focus fire on the Thunderwolf Cavalry first to remove the army's speed.
Move-block the Vindicator to deny it firing angles.

viralInsights.spiritDescription: An unstoppable wall of terminator armor and snarling beasts that crashes into the enemy line with the inevitability of a glacier.

primary.description: Absorb the enemy's opening volley with 2+ saves and Storm Shields, then trigger the 'Ferocious Strike' Saga to wipe them out in melee.

secondary.description: Using Thunderwolf Cavalry speed and Deep Striking Inceptors to pressure the enemy deployment zone on Turn 2.

funStats.name: Invuln Wall
funStats.description: 80% of units carry Storm Shields (4++). High-AP weapons are mathematically wasted against this list.
funStats.iconPrompt: A battered storm shield deflecting a high-energy lascannon beam, sparks flying, dark battlefield background

funStats.name: Deep Strike Payload
funStats.description: Over 500 points arriving Turn 2 via Deep Strike - massive backline threat that opponents must screen against.
funStats.iconPrompt: A massive terminator materializing from teleportation energy, lightning crackling, dark void background

viralInsights.armySpiritIconPrompt: A massive Space Wolf Terminator stepping on a tyranid skull, blizzard swirling around, glowing blue eyes, wolf pelt on shoulders, comic book style with heavy black ink lines and cold blue tones

unitTacticalSummaries.Bjorn the Fell-Handed: Your durable CP generator. Keep him central to discourage deep strikes and provide fire support, but don't throw him away early.
unitTacticalSummaries.Inceptor Squad: Your problem solvers. Deep strike them 3 inches away (Meteoric Descent) to steal backfield objectives or assassinate lone characters.
unitTacticalSummaries.Vindicator: A distraction Carnifex with a gun. Push it aggressively up a flank to draw fire; if ignored, its S14 cannon deletes tanks.
unitTacticalSummaries.Wolf Guard Headtakers: Glass cannons. Attach the Wolf Guard Battle Leader here for [LANCE] and [SUSTAINED HITS]. Deliver them carefully; if they get shot, they die.
unitTacticalSummaries.Wolf Guard Terminators (340pts): The main event. Attach Logan and Arjac here. Deep strike them into the center or use Rapid Ingress to ensure a charge.
unitTacticalSummaries.Thunderwolf Cavalry: The missile. Use 'Encircling Jaws' to advance and charge early. They must tie up enemy shooting units to protect the foot sloggers.
unitTacticalSummaries.Wolf Guard Terminators (170pts): The secondary anvil. Use them to hold a flank objective or reinforce the main push. Don't expect them to kill a Knight alone.
unitTacticalSummaries.Lieutenant with Combi-weapon: Your primary scorer. Use his Lone Operative ability to sit on open objectives or perform actions while being untargetable >12 inches.
unitTacticalSummaries.Wolf Guard Battle Leader: The damage amplifier. Attach to the Headtakers to give them [LANCE]. This turns S5 attacks into vehicle killers on the charge.
unitTacticalSummaries.Intercessor Squad: Home objective sitters. Use their 'Sticky Objectives' rule to tag your home point, then move up to screen or perform secondaries.
unitTacticalSummaries.Arjac Rockfist: The monster hunter. Attach to the big Terminator brick. Use his 'Epic Challenge' stratagem (Core Rules) to snipe enemy characters in melee.
unitTacticalSummaries.Logan Grimnar: The buff commander. Use his 'High King of Fenris' ability once per game to reactivate a powerful Saga (usually Ferocious Strike) for a second turn of carnage.

Bjorn the Fell-Handed.reasoning: Primary value is increasing stratagem cost for opponents (if applicable) or generating CP/tanking, rather than pure damage output.

Inceptor Squad.reasoning: Meteoric Descent allows them to drop anywhere to steal points or snipe weak units.

Vindicator.reasoning: Dedicated heavy armor cracker in a list that mostly relies on melee for anti-tank.

Wolf Guard Headtakers.reasoning: With the attached Battle Leader giving Lance, they are a pure damage missile aimed at elites or light vehicles.

Wolf Guard Terminators (340pts).reasoning: With Arjac and Logan, they are the hardest unit to shift in the army and occupy the center board.

Thunderwolf Cavalry.reasoning: Fast, hard-hitting, and designed to crash into enemy lines on Turn 1 or 2.

Wolf Guard Terminators (170pts).reasoning: A smaller durable unit to hold a flank objective.

Lieutenant with Combi-weapon.reasoning: Lone Operative makes him the only safe unit to hold objectives in the open.

Wolf Guard Battle Leader.reasoning: Existing solely to buff the Headtakers with Lance and Sustained Hits.

Intercessor Squad.reasoning: Sticky objectives ability allows them to secure points and move on.

Arjac Rockfist.reasoning: Provides significant buffs (Anti-Monster/Vehicle) to his unit and fights on death.

Logan Grimnar.reasoning: While he hits hard, his primary role is unlocking the 'Howling Onslaught' detachment ability re-roll.

removeUnits.name: Wolf Guard Terminators (170pts)
removeUnits.reason: This secondary Terminator unit is slow (M5) and expensive for holding flank objectives, exacerbating the army's critical board control deficit.

addUnits.name: Infiltrator Squad
addUnits.reason: Provides a 12-inch deep strike denial bubble to protect your home objective and heavy hitters (Bjorn/Vindicator) from enemy reserves.

addUnits.name: Scout Squad
addUnits.reason: Cheap utility unit with 'Guerilla Tactics' (uppy-downy) to score secondary objectives like Investigate Signals or Cleanse without wasting elite combat units.

listSuggestions.tradeoffs: Reduces total army durability and melee punch on one flank, as 5 Terminators are replaced by T4 power armor bodies.
synergiesEnabled: Infiltrators ensure the backfield is safe, allowing the main 'Death Star' to push forward aggressively using 'Encircling Jaws'.

removeUnits.name: Wolf Guard Terminators (170pts)
removeUnits.reason: This unit struggles to contribute against the 'Vehicle Spam' archetype identified as an unfavorable matchup due to lack of range.

addUnits.name: Gladiator Lancer
addUnits.reason: Adds a dedicated long-range (72") anti-tank platform with high reliability (built-in re-rolls) to threaten enemy armor from Turn 1.

listSuggestions.tradeoffs: Lowers model count and infantry presence; the Lancer cannot move through ruins like the Terminators.
synergiesEnabled: Benefits from 'Hunter's Eye' Saga (+1 to Hit) to hit on 2s, freeing up the Vindicator to push aggressively while the Lancer holds angles.
